pull.title: test: Mockwallet
pull.body: This introduces a minimalistic test wallet, which can be used as a drop in replacement for the Bitcoin Core wallet to create dummy transactions with a given fee rate.

verification.payload:
tree 26e6887676f9b150ecd396a9fd7318a3c4d0edb7
parent 8e0f341779e1d2754432765ec09deb7488f5b093
author MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1598349253 +0200
committer MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1598358445 +0200

test: inline hashToHex

events.body: Very cool. Strong concept ACK if this allows us to build transactions outside the wallet more easily.

Concept ACK, tested ACK, very nice. 

A few style nits below, feel free to ignore.
Would be good to make progress here, so that the mockwallet can be used in new tests
This is great. I've left lots of small style comments. Nothing blocking though.
Force pushed second commit to address @jnewbery's feedback

verification.payload:
tree 9003eb5e71dad2d720ad561d8f474acf15fc80e5

test: Use MiniWalet in p2p_feefilter

comments.body: do you think this should live in wallet_util (the docstring says "Useful util functions for testing the wallet") or should it be in its own module?

@@ -0,0 +1,64 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2020 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""A limited-functionality wallet, which may replace a real wallet in tests"""
+
+from test_framework.address import ADDRESS_BCRT1_P2WSH_OP_TRUE
+from test_framework.messages import (
+    COIN,
+    CTransaction,
+    CTxIn,
+    COutPoint,
+    CTxOut,
+    CTxInWitness,
+)
+from test_framework.script import (
+    CScript,
+    OP_TRUE,
+)
+from test_framework.util import (
+    assert_equal,
+    hex_str_to_bytes,
+    satoshi_round,
+)
+from decimal import Decimal
+
+
+class MiniWallet():
+    def __init__(self, test_node):
+        self._test_node = test_node
+        self._utxos = []
+        self._address = ADDRESS_BCRT1_P2WSH_OP_TRUE
+        self._scriptPubKey = hex_str_to_bytes(self._test_node.validateaddress(self._address)['scriptPubKey'])
+
+    def generate(self, num_blocks):
+        blocks = self._test_node.generatetoaddress(num_blocks, self.getnewaddress())
+        for b in blocks:
+            cb_tx = self._test_node.getblock(b, 2)['tx'][0]
+            self._utxos.append({'txid': cb_tx['txid'], 'vout': 0, 'value': cb_tx['vout'][0]['value']})
+        return blocks
+
+    def getnewaddress(self):
+        return self._address
+
+    def send_self_transfer(self, *, fee_rate, from_node=None):
+        if from_node is None:
+            from_node = self._test_node
+        self._utxos = sorted(self._utxos, key=lambda k: -k['value'])
+        largest_utxo = self._utxos.pop()  # Pick the largest utxo and hope it covers the fee
+        vsize = Decimal('96')
comments.body:
no need for quotes?

```suggestion
        vsize = Decimal(96)
```

@@ -0,0 +1,62 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2020 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""A limited-functionality wallet, which may replace a real wallet in tests"""
+
+from test_framework.address import ADDRESS_BCRT1_P2WSH_OP_TRUE
+from test_framework.messages import (
+    COIN,
+    COutPoint,
+    CTransaction,
+    CTxIn,
+    CTxInWitness,
+    CTxOut,
+)
+from test_framework.script import (
+    CScript,
+    OP_TRUE,
+)
+from test_framework.util import (
+    assert_equal,
+    hex_str_to_bytes,
+    satoshi_round,
+)
+from decimal import Decimal
+
+
+class MiniWallet:
+    def __init__(self, test_node):
+        self._test_node = test_node
+        self._utxos = []
+        self._address = ADDRESS_BCRT1_P2WSH_OP_TRUE
+        self._scriptPubKey = hex_str_to_bytes(self._test_node.validateaddress(self._address)['scriptPubKey'])
+
+    def generate(self, num_blocks):
+        blocks = self._test_node.generatetoaddress(num_blocks, self.getnewaddress())
+        for b in blocks:
+            cb_tx = self._test_node.getblock(b, 2)['tx'][0]
+            self._utxos.append({'txid': cb_tx['txid'], 'vout': 0, 'value': cb_tx['vout'][0]['value']})
comments.body: Seems like the "wallet" doesn't know which funds are mature?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,62 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2020 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""A limited-functionality wallet, which may replace a real wallet in tests"""
+
+from test_framework.address import ADDRESS_BCRT1_P2WSH_OP_TRUE
+from test_framework.messages import (
+    COIN,
+    COutPoint,
+    CTransaction,
+    CTxIn,
+    CTxInWitness,
+    CTxOut,
+)
+from test_framework.script import (
+    CScript,
+    OP_TRUE,
+)
+from test_framework.util import (
+    assert_equal,
+    hex_str_to_bytes,
+    satoshi_round,
+)
+from decimal import Decimal
+
+
+class MiniWallet:
+    def __init__(self, test_node):
+        self._test_node = test_node
+        self._utxos = []
+        self._address = ADDRESS_BCRT1_P2WSH_OP_TRUE
+        self._scriptPubKey = hex_str_to_bytes(self._test_node.validateaddress(self._address)['scriptPubKey'])
+
+    def generate(self, num_blocks):
+        blocks = self._test_node.generatetoaddress(num_blocks, self.getnewaddress())
+        for b in blocks:
+            cb_tx = self._test_node.getblock(b, 2)['tx'][0]
+            self._utxos.append({'txid': cb_tx['txid'], 'vout': 0, 'value': cb_tx['vout'][0]['value']})
comments.body: The wallet will "sign" any transaction you ask it to sign. Also, coin selection is deterministic, so if immature funds are spent, it will be noticed when writing the test.

comments.body:
The wallet doesn't currently query the chain in any way, so it has no notion of number of confirmations.

If this is ever needed, it can be added later

+#!/usr/bin/env python3

+    COIN,
+    COutPoint,

+    CTxIn,
+    CTxInWitness,
+    CTxOut,
+)

+)
+from decimal import Decimal
+

+class MiniWallet:

+        self._test_node = test_node
+        self._utxos = []
+        self._address = ADDRESS_BCRT1_P2WSH_OP_TRUE
+        self._scriptPubKey = hex_str_to_bytes(self._test_node.validateaddress(self._address)['scriptPubKey'])
+
+    def generate(self, num_blocks):

+        for b in blocks:

comments.body: Rather than hoping, can you assert that send_value below is +ve, for a more helpful error message.

+
+    def generate(self, num_blocks):
+        blocks = self._test_node.generatetoaddress(num_blocks, self.getnewaddress())
+        for b in blocks:
+            cb_tx = self._test_node.getblock(b, 2)['tx'][0]
+            self._utxos.append({'txid': cb_tx['txid'], 'vout': 0, 'value': cb_tx['vout'][0]['value']})
+        return blocks
+
+    def getnewaddress(self):
+        return self._address
+
+    def send_self_transfer(self, *, fee_rate, from_node):
comments.body: It feels to me like the transaction construction/signing should be separated from the relaying. ie this function's responsibility should be to return a serialized transaction that the caller can then submit from any node (or manually over a p2p connection)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -83,27 +77,27 @@ def test_feefilter_forcerelay(self):
     def test_feefilter(self):
         node1 = self.nodes[1]
         node0 = self.nodes[0]
+        miniwallet = MiniWallet(node1)
+        miniwallet.generate(5)
comments.body:
I think this can just be `generate(1)` since the output UTXO can always be used in subsequent tests.

Could probably do with a comment so it's obvious why two different generate commands are being used here.
